Well, its been a while. I was motivated by boredom and Wendy. She told me to update this shit, so I am. Yesterday I went to Kyle and Kenny's joint birthday party. It was a good time. I'm really not a party person and i dont like being large groups, but i liked it. I swam a lot. A lot with kushi, rach, hannah and some other people. T'was fun. The other week, I went to Kristen's B-day party. I swam alot there too. I guess a lot of my summer involves swimming. 

Things have been ok for me lately. Better since my last entry. Things are going to be alright and i've begun to relax a little. I still do nothing everyday and rarely leave my house. Regardless, its still ok. I'm still not as happy day by day as I wish, but eh..it could be worse..much worse. 

I need to start getting in shape for soccer, which I am actually playing this year. I know i'm one of the laziest people ever...so its gunna be tough...wish me luck...or ill punch you. =p

Well, thats about it for now.

Have a good one, folks.


Mikey, signing out.

I hate times like this. The last few days have been some of the hardest in my life...

I just wish it was all a bad dream and I could go on with nothing like this in my life. I just want to stop worrying...

Trent Reznor is angry at you...and pretty much everything else as well.

I've been addicted to Nine Inch Nails for some time now. I know its not my usual style of music, but the music has really grown on me and the lyrics are amazing. I know most of you have only heard "Closer," but that isn't one of my favorites. I love how fucking angst and sadness driven every fucking song is. Seriously, this is some of the most emotional music I have listened to. I don't even know why I am typing all of this! It is 1 am on a Tuesday and I have that kind of time.

This summer has sucked major goat ass on a whole. Not a shapely, buh-dunka-dunk, goat ass, mind you. A horrid, smelly, rank goat ass of sorts. I have had one or 2 good days. I still haven't spent enough time with some of my good friends as I had hoped. Well there is still lots of time...to stay home and wallow in my own self-pity and angst just like Trent Reznor does. Oh well! Ciao.

It was a good weekend. I actually did....things. Because of the occasion, I am going to write the stereotypical summary of the weekend's festivities because I am that predictable. So here'goes, kiddies!

Friday was a good day. School was easy yet tiring. Big surprise there. That night I was invited to go to the movies with Wendy and Sarah. It was a really good time. I got to the point where I would go anywhere or do anything because I just wanted to leave the house. We say Miss Congeniality 2. I had never seen the first but this movie was actually pretty entertaining. Wendy came over afterward and we just hung around and watched some Who's Line and relaxed before she went home. A fun night. Thanks folks.

Saturday was another good day. (whoa...I actually had 2 good days in a row. The happiness wasn't just raped and ripped to shreds as usual by something crappy.) I hung around all day and did nothing. It was a really crappy, rainy day so I decided to sleep most of the day away. I slept until about 1:30 then emerged to greet the living. Later that night I went to Kyle's house with Kenny, Hudak and Brett. It was a good time. I never hang out with them anymore. We played some pool, went to Friendly's and went back to Kyle's before I had to go home. A good day.

Sunday was yet another good day, for the most part. (This has got to be a record. 3 happy days in a row. Oh yes. *cherishes*) I wasn't expecting to do anything today and just lay around like a slug but Barbara thought otherwise. =p She invited me to the mall, which was good because I had to buy a thing or two so it worked out alllll good. It was a good time. Thanks, Barbara. "I saw a flock of rabbits today...er....a group..." =p






I'm so of sick of having my heart ripped out of my chest cavity that I think i'll just leave it out of there for a while...and see how I do or don't feel and who I do or don't miss...






Until next time,
Mikey, signing out.

I couldn't care less about Terry Schiavo. She's dead as we all knew she would be eventually. Hundreds of Ethiopians die of starvation everyday. Care about that, you media fucktards.

Anyways, I am really writing to say goodbye to Mitch Hedberg, my favorite comedian, who passed away today at the age of 37. I don't know why, but this hit me pretty hard. Maybe it was his age. I don't know. He was hilarious and put smiles on so many people's faces with his odd sense of humor and creativity. A great man indeed. He helped me through some tough time when I needed to laugh badly. Thanks for all the smiles and laughs, Mitch.

Rest In Peace.

Last weekend and the beginning of this week have been pretty darn good so far I suppose. Most of it has been recently focused on my friend Rachel who I just can't seem to not love heh. I have talked on the phone with her almost every night for a week or so and my god, shes wonderful. =) She came over today after school and on Sunday. Thanks for everything, Rach. =) I had one hell of a busy weekend. On Thursday night I went out to eat with Miss Rachel and we chilled at my house for a bit. On Friday, I went to the all-star basketball games with the pep band, as described in my previous entry. It was an alright time I suppose. Thanks for the bagels Dave! The time-outs in the second game got progressively shorter so we decided to leave early, seeing as we could not finish one song with the time given. It was all good though. On Saturday, I was supposed to go to Boston with the Family to clean out my Grandpa's house but that ended up not working out. That night was Sir Kushi's B-day Extravaganza. It was a heck of a good time. I had fun chilling with people I dont normally chill with, so I really enjoyed myself. Swell times. Sunday was the parade in Holyoke. It was such a god damn drag. We waited around for 2 hours, waiting to start marching because the parade was so long. I was ready to fall asleep by the time we actually started. The parade was freaking enormous. Very long and slow and stressful, seeing as I never stop playing and my drum is so damn heavy. Anyone who wasn't a drummer forfeits their right to complain as instructed by me. I win. I sweated through my uniform I was working so hard. It was like 35 degrees out and I sweated through my uniform and a t-shirt. I win once again. I also received my first blister in a ages. Its all good though.

That is about it for now I suppose. Not much to tell about this week so far. It's only Monday.

Until next time,
Mikey, signing out.

A busy but fun weekend ahead of me. You know what I like? Comments.

Until next time,
